perturbation.original_text: Statement of Work Developer will design, develop, and deliver, satisfactory to Client, the "Pelican Delivers Application Phase 1" (collectively, the Subject Program), and all elated Project services (collectively, the Services), Project work product (collectively, the Deliverables), and user manuals and other written material that describe he functionality or assist in the use of the Subject Program (collectively, the Documentation), pursuant to the Project specifications detailed in the SO (collectively, Specifications), as described in the enclosed statement of work (the SOW; as provided in APPENDIX A hereto). The Parties may execute multiple SOWs should there be multiple or separate Projects. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Agreement and any SOW, the terms of this Agreement will control.
perturbation.changed_text: Statement of Work Developer will design, develop, and deliver, satisfactory to Client, the "Pelican Delivers Application Phase 1" (collectively, the Subject Program), and all elated Project services (collectively, the Services), Project work product (collectively, the Deliverables), and user manuals and other written material that describe he functionality or assist in the use of the Subject Program (collectively, the Documentation), pursuant to general project goals (collectively, Specifications). The Parties may execute multiple project outlines should there be multiple or separate projects. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Agreement and any project outline, the terms of this Agreement will control.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit reference to 'APPENDIX A hereto' containing the Statement of Work (SOW) and replacing it with 'general project goals,' the contract now lacks a clearly defined specification document. Subsequent sections that rely on the SOW for details like 'Delivery Schedule; Acceptance; Change Orders' will become ambiguous and unenforceable, creating an internal contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: FEES AND EXPENSES All Fees shall be due pursuant to the Fee payment schedule provided in a SOW hereto (the Fee Payment Schedule). Client's failure to remit payment to Developer for Fees due and owning will constitute a material breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: FEES AND EXPENSES All Fees shall be due according to standard business practices. Client's failure to remit payment to Developer for Fees due and owning will constitute a material breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting 'pursuant to the Fee payment schedule provided in a SOW hereto (the Fee Payment Schedule),' the contract no longer specifies how fees are to be paid. This creates a contradiction because Section 5.1 still refers to 'Fees...as Described in the SOW', however the definition of Fee Payment Schedule, referencing SOW, is removed. This omission creates uncertainty about payment terms and schedule and contradicts the later mention of Fees in SOW.

perturbation.original_text: OBLIGATIONS UPON TERMINATION If Client terminates this Agreement or any SOW for any reason, Client will pay Developer any Fees due and payable on the effective date of such termination or expiration, and Developer will refund to Client any non-accrued pre-paid Fees. In the event of a termination or expiration of this Agreement or any SOW for any reason, developer will, as requested by and at additional cost to Client, provide up to three (3) months of Fee billable assistance (collectively, the Termination Assistance Services) in transitioning from Developer to an alternative software service provider including, without limitation, the following: (a) knowledge transfer regarding the operation, use, and support of the subject Program; return of all documentation containing Content, Marks, Procedures a d Confidential Information in a format reasonably specified by Client and assistance with data migration to an alternative solution; and (c) any related additional services as requested by Client. Developer shall provide Termination Assistance Services to Client in a manner that does not interfere with, interrupt or degrade the Subject Program. The term of this Agreement or applicable SOW shall not be deemed to have expired or terminated until the Termination Assistance Services are completed.
perturbation.changed_text: OBLIGATIONS UPON TERMINATION If Client terminates this Agreement for any reason, Client will pay Developer any Fees due and payable on the effective date of such termination or expiration, and Developer will refund to Client any non-accrued pre-paid Fees. In the event of a termination or expiration of this Agreement for any reason, developer will, as requested by and at additional cost to Client, provide assistance in transitioning from Developer to an alternative software service provider including, without limitation, the following: (a) knowledge transfer regarding the operation, use, and support of the subject Program; return of all documentation containing Content, Marks, Procedures and Confidential Information in a reasonable format and assistance with data migration to an alternative solution; and (c) any related additional services as requested by Client. Developer shall provide Assistance Services to Client in a manner that does not interfere with, interrupt or degrade the Subject Program.
perturbation.explanation: By removing references to 'any SOW,' the applicability of termination obligations to individual Statements of Work is now ambiguous. Additionally, removing 'up to three (3) months of Fee billable assistance (collectively, the Termination Assistance Services)' alters the understanding of the service. It is not clear what support can be expected during the transition and for how long.
